thread.title: Southampton road to be shut for days
thread.title_full: Southampton road to be shut for days

title: Southampton road to be shut for days
text:
Winchester Road in Southampton will be partially closed for gas works Southampton road to be shut for days 4 comments 
DELAYS are expected for days on a Southampton road as gas works are carried out. 
SGN Gas have today begun essential upgrades to the gas main in Winchester Road, closing the lane by the junction of Hill Lane, with a section of that road also shut off. 
In a statement on SGN's website, the company said: “We are very sorry for the inconvenience caused and would like to thank road users for their patience while we carry out this essential upgrade work.” Share article 
The work is expected to take approximately four days. 
By Will Rimell Winchester Road in Southampton will be partially closed for gas works Sorry, an error occurred. 2 blokes there this morning, one moving barriers about, the other sat in a mini digger, absolute joke 2 blokes there this morning, one moving barriers about, the other sat in a mini digger, absolute joke bigfella777

That description of which parts are shut is as clear as mud. Why even bother to publish rubbish like this ? That description of which parts are shut is as clear as mud. Why even bother to publish rubbish like this ? theburrower 
That description of which parts are shut is as clear as mud. Why even bother to publish rubbish like this ? Report Score: 0 Costa Baz 2:29pm Thu 22 Oct 15 
One end of Wilton road has been shut for 2 or 3 months now, forcing traffic that turns right out of Hill Lane, into Milton Road, with the intention of going through to Bedford Place, to now queue at the Archers Rd traffic lights, stopping traffic from flowing, as there is no right turn filter lane, or signal. With the length of this closure, you would think the traffic planners would have altered the Hill Lane/Archers Road traffic lights to allow for the traffic being diverted. But then again, it is Southampton.
